title: How many feet is 1 square metre in length and width? - Quora

response.answer_text: Hello, A Metre is metric unit as is larger than 1 square yard which is imperial unit and has 9 square feet in 1 square yard. Answer is that 1 square Metre has the C.S.A. of 10. 764 square feet.A square metre is equivalent to .37″ inches x 39.37″, This compares to 1 square yard which is 36″ x 36″ inches. So with the difference in both measurements 39.37″ inches to 36″ inches = 3.37″ inches increases the CSA.

A foot is a unit of linear measurement. A square meter is a unit of area. The two are not interchangeable. Further, 1 square meter can have any length and width which multiples to 1 ; e.g., 1 = 1 X 1 = 0.5 X 2 = 0.1 X 10, etc. So, 1 meter squared = 10.78 square feet.
